title: DAA
content: how tf should i study daa. Its so fking confusing , at first i used to understand later as soon as she taught asymptotic notations , it ran straight out of my head. Is there any playlist that aligns with oour college course , also i would definitly know i wouldnt understand fuck if i read tb.

comments.body:
It's one of the easier and logic focused courses in the entire 4 years. Put some effort and you should get it. Just search each topic on YouTube and you should get more than enough videos explaining everything. 

Good luck

Thank dude
Will give this a shot

Adding to it, ensure you actually understand concepts and do not memorise. It will simply come back to bite you later.

DAA forms the basis for your placement prep and is crucial to getting a good job.
would you recommend reading the prescribed textbook for this course? or would youtube videos and slides be better?
Not sure. I didn't really use the textbook for DAA although the prescribed book is amazing. I primarily listened in class and practiced questions online.
Do anything that helps you understand the topic, it's sort of like maths. Once you start getting it, you've won.
it was the easiest scoring subject for us. and it also had less concepts per unit . those asymptotic notations and time complexities will save your ass in isa & esa both .
